title: Robbie Williams admits he smoked CANNABIS inside Buckingham Palace
text:
Robbie Williams admits he smoked CANNABIS inside Buckingham Palace It's thought he lit up when he performed for the Queen's Diamond Jubilee Concert in 2012     
Robbie Williams has admitted he smoked marijuana inside Buckingham Palace. 
It's thought the Let Me Entertain You singer - who has been open about using the class B substance in the past - lit up in the summer of 2012 when he was performing at the Queen's Diamond Jubilee Concert. 
Asked by The Sun Online whether he'd ever been sick at the palace, the cheeky star revealed: "Threw up in Buckingham Palace? No. I smoked a spliff in Buckingham Palace." Robbie Williams performs on stage during the Diamond Jubilee concert at Buckingham Palace (Photo: Getty) He admitted he smoked cannabis at the palace (Photo: Getty) 
Speaking previously in 2013, he admitted he still uses the drug recreationally - despite having two trips to rehab. 
"The last time I got high was two days ago. No big drug sessions, mind, just a small amount, purely to relax," he said at the time. The singer has been open about smoking in the past (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Robbie isn't the first famous face to have smoked cannabis in Westminster. 
John Lennon once admitted that when The Beatles were awarded MBEs in 1965, that were misbehaving beforehand.
